views.definition:
SELECT n.oid AS nsp_oid,
    n.nspname AS schema_name,
    r.rolname AS owner
   FROM pg_namespace n
     JOIN pg_roles r ON r.oid = n.nspowner
  WHERE n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY n.nspname;

SELECT c.relname AS object_name,
    c.relkind AS kind
   FROM pg_class c
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
  WHERE n.nspname = 'auth'::name
  ORDER BY c.relkind, c.relname;

WITH has_col AS (
         SELECT columns.table_schema AS schema,
            columns.table_name,
            columns.column_name
           FROM information_schema.columns
          WHERE columns.table_schema::name = 'public'::name AND columns.table_name::name ~~ 'chat_%'::text
        )
 SELECT 'public'::name::information_schema.sql_identifier AS schema,
    table_name,
    NOT (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM has_col
          WHERE has_col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND has_col.column_name::name = 'account_id'::name)) AS missing_account_id,
        CASE
            WHEN table_name::name = ANY (ARRAY['chat_messages'::name, 'chat_attachments'::name, 'chat_reactions'::name]) THEN NOT (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
               FROM has_col
              WHERE has_col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND has_col.column_name::name = 'device_id'::name))
            ELSE false
        END AS missing_device_id,
        CASE
            WHEN table_name::name = ANY (ARRAY['chat_messages'::name, 'chat_attachments'::name, 'chat_reactions'::name]) THEN NOT (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
               FROM has_col
              WHERE has_col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND has_col.column_name::name = 'local_id'::name))
            ELSE false
        END AS missing_local_id
   FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT tables.table_name
           FROM information_schema.tables
          WHERE tables.table_schema::name = 'public'::name AND tables.table_name::name ~~ 'chat_%'::text) t
  ORDER BY table_name;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    c.relname AS table_name,
    con.conname AS constraint_name,
    con.contype AS constraint_type,
    pg_get_constraintdef(con.oid) AS definition,
    con.convalidated AS validated,
    con.condeferrable AS "deferrable",
    con.condeferred AS deferred
   FROM pg_constraint con
     JOIN pg_class c ON c.oid = con.conrelid
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
  WHERE n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY n.nspname, c.relname, con.contype, con.conname;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    t.relname AS table_name,
    i1.relname AS index1,
    i2.relname AS index2,
    pg_get_indexdef(i1.oid) AS index1_def,
    pg_get_indexdef(i2.oid) AS index2_def
   FROM pg_index x
     JOIN pg_class i1 ON i1.oid = x.indexrelid
     JOIN pg_class t ON t.oid = x.indrelid
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.relnamespace
     JOIN pg_index y ON y.indrelid = x.indrelid AND y.indexrelid > x.indexrelid
     JOIN pg_class i2 ON i2.oid = y.indexrelid
  WHERE (n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])) AND x.indkey = y.indkey AND x.indclass = y.indclass AND NOT x.indpred::text IS DISTINCT FROM y.indpred::text;

SELECT e.extname AS extension,
    e.extversion AS version,
    n.nspname AS schema
   FROM pg_extension e
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = e.extnamespace
  ORDER BY e.extname;

WITH fk AS (
         SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
            c.relname AS table_name,
            con.conname AS fk_name,
            pg_get_constraintdef(con.oid) AS fk_def,
            con.conkey AS src_cols_attnums,
            con.confkey AS dst_cols_attnums,
            con.conrelid AS src_oid,
            con.confrelid AS dst_oid,
            con.confupdtype,
            con.confdeltype
           FROM pg_constraint con
             JOIN pg_class c ON c.oid = con.conrelid
             JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
          WHERE con.contype = 'f'::"char" AND (n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name]))
        )
 SELECT schema,
    table_name,
    fk_name,
    ( SELECT array_agg(a.attname ORDER BY k.ord) AS array_agg
           FROM unnest(fk.src_cols_attnums) WITH ORDINALITY k(attnum, ord)
             JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = fk.src_oid AND a.attnum = k.attnum) AS src_cols,
    ( SELECT pg_class.relname
           FROM pg_class
          WHERE pg_class.oid = fk.dst_oid) AS ref_table,
    ( SELECT array_agg(a.attname ORDER BY k.ord) AS array_agg
           FROM unnest(fk.dst_cols_attnums) WITH ORDINALITY k(attnum, ord)
             JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = fk.dst_oid AND a.attnum = k.attnum) AS ref_cols,
        CASE confupdtype
            WHEN 'a'::"char" THEN 'NO ACTION'::text
            WHEN 'r'::"char" THEN 'RESTRICT'::text
            WHEN 'c'::"char" THEN 'CASCADE'::text
            WHEN 'n'::"char" THEN 'SET NULL'::text
            WHEN 'd'::"char" THEN 'SET DEFAULT'::text
            ELSE confupdtype::text
        END AS on_update,
        CASE confdeltype
            WHEN 'a'::"char" THEN 'NO ACTION'::text
            WHEN 'r'::"char" THEN 'RESTRICT'::text
            WHEN 'c'::"char" THEN 'CASCADE'::text
            WHEN 'n'::"char" THEN 'SET NULL'::text
            WHEN 'd'::"char" THEN 'SET DEFAULT'::text
            ELSE confdeltype::text
        END AS on_delete
   FROM fk
  ORDER BY schema, table_name, fk_name;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    p.proname AS function_name,
    l.lanname AS language,
    pg_get_function_result(p.oid) AS returns,
    p.prokind AS kind,
    p.provolatile AS volatility,
    p.prosecdef AS security_definer,
    obj_description(p.oid) AS description
   FROM pg_proc p
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = p.pronamespace
     JOIN pg_language l ON l.oid = p.prolang
  WHERE n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY n.nspname, p.proname;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    t.relname AS table_name,
    i.relname AS index_name,
    ix.indisunique AS is_unique,
    ix.indisprimary AS is_primary,
    ix.indisvalid AS is_valid,
    pg_get_indexdef(i.oid) AS index_def
   FROM pg_index ix
     JOIN pg_class t ON t.oid = ix.indrelid
     JOIN pg_class i ON i.oid = ix.indexrelid
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.relnamespace
  WHERE n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY n.nspname, t.relname, i.relname;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    c.relname AS matview_name,
    pg_get_viewdef(c.oid, true) AS definition
   FROM pg_class c
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
  WHERE c.relkind = 'm'::"char" AND (n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name]))
  ORDER BY n.nspname, c.relname;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    t.relname AS table_name,
    con.conname AS fk_name,
    ( SELECT array_agg(a.attname ORDER BY k.ord) AS array_agg
           FROM unnest(con.conkey) WITH ORDINALITY k(attnum, ord)
             JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = t.oid AND a.attnum = k.attnum) AS src_cols
   FROM pg_constraint con
     JOIN pg_class t ON t.oid = con.conrelid
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.relnamespace
  WHERE con.contype = 'f'::"char" AND (n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])) AND NOT (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM pg_index i
          WHERE i.indrelid = t.oid AND i.indisvalid AND (i.indkey::smallint[])[1:array_length(con.conkey, 1)] = con.conkey))
  ORDER BY n.nspname, t.relname, con.conname;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    c.relname AS object_name,
        CASE c.relkind
            WHEN 'r'::"char" THEN 'table'::text
            WHEN 'v'::"char" THEN 'view'::text
            WHEN 'm'::"char" THEN 'materialized_view'::text
            WHEN 'i'::"char" THEN 'index'::text
            WHEN 'S'::"char" THEN 'sequence'::text
            WHEN 'f'::"char" THEN 'foreign_table'::text
            WHEN 'p'::"char" THEN 'partitioned_table'::text
            WHEN 'I'::"char" THEN 'partitioned_index'::text
            ELSE c.relkind::text
        END AS kind,
    pg_get_userbyid(c.relowner) AS owner,
    c.relrowsecurity AS rls_enabled,
    c.relforcerowsecurity AS rls_forced,
    obj_description(c.oid) AS description
   FROM pg_class c
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
  WHERE n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY n.nspname, (
        CASE c.relkind
            WHEN 'r'::"char" THEN 'table'::text
            WHEN 'v'::"char" THEN 'view'::text
            WHEN 'm'::"char" THEN 'materialized_view'::text
            WHEN 'i'::"char" THEN 'index'::text
            WHEN 'S'::"char" THEN 'sequence'::text
            WHEN 'f'::"char" THEN 'foreign_table'::text
            WHEN 'p'::"char" THEN 'partitioned_table'::text
            WHEN 'I'::"char" THEN 'partitioned_index'::text
            ELSE c.relkind::text
        END), c.relname;

SELECT schema,
    table_name,
    rls_enabled,
    rls_forced,
    owner
   FROM admin.tables t
  WHERE rls_enabled IS TRUE AND NOT (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM admin.rls_policies p
          WHERE p.schema = t.schema::name AND p.table_name = t.table_name::name))
  ORDER BY schema, table_name;

SELECT schemaname AS schema,
    tablename AS table_name,
    policyname AS policy_name,
    permissive,
    roles,
    cmd AS command,
    qual AS using_expr,
    with_check AS check_expr
   FROM pg_policies
  WHERE schemaname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY schemaname, tablename, policyname;

WITH tbls AS (
         SELECT c_1.oid,
            n.nspname AS schema,
            c_1.relname AS name,
            c_1.relkind,
            c_1.relrowsecurity
           FROM pg_class c_1
             JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c_1.relnamespace
          WHERE n.nspname = 'public'::name AND (c_1.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'p'::"char"]))
        ), cols AS (
         SELECT columns.table_schema,
            columns.table_name,
            bool_or(columns.column_name::name = 'account_id'::name) AS has_account_id,
            bool_or(columns.column_name::name = 'updated_at'::name) AS has_updated_at
           FROM information_schema.columns
          WHERE columns.table_schema::name = 'public'::name
          GROUP BY columns.table_schema, columns.table_name
        ), touch_trg AS (
         SELECT t_1.tgrelid AS oid
           FROM pg_trigger t_1
             JOIN pg_proc p_1 ON p_1.oid = t_1.tgfoid
          WHERE NOT t_1.tgisinternal AND p_1.proname = 'tg_touch_updated_at'::name
        ), fill_trg AS (
         SELECT t_1.tgrelid AS oid
           FROM pg_trigger t_1
             JOIN pg_proc p_1 ON p_1.oid = t_1.tgfoid
          WHERE NOT t_1.tgisinternal AND p_1.proname = 'tg_fill_account_id'::name
        ), pol AS (
         SELECT p_1.polrelid AS oid,
            count(*) FILTER (WHERE p_1.polname ~~ 'pol_%'::text) AS pol_star,
            count(*) FILTER (WHERE p_1.polname !~~ 'pol_%'::text) AS pol_legacy
           FROM pg_policy p_1
          GROUP BY p_1.polrelid
        ), idx AS (
         SELECT i.indexrelid,
            i.indrelid,
            i.indisunique,
            am.amname,
            COALESCE(pg_get_expr(i.indpred, i.indrelid), ''::text) AS pred,
            COALESCE(pg_get_expr(i.indexprs, i.indrelid), ''::text) AS exprs,
            i.indkey::text AS k,
            i.indcollation::text AS coll,
            i.indclass::text AS cls,
            i.indoption::text AS opt
           FROM pg_index i
             JOIN pg_class t_1 ON t_1.oid = i.indrelid
             JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t_1.relnamespace
             JOIN pg_class c_1 ON c_1.oid = i.indexrelid
             JOIN pg_am am ON am.oid = c_1.relam
          WHERE n.nspname = 'public'::name AND (t_1.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'p'::"char"]))
        ), idx_dups AS (
         SELECT d_1.indrelid,
            sum(d_1.cnt - 1) AS dup_indexes
           FROM ( SELECT idx.indrelid,
                    idx.indisunique,
                    idx.amname,
                    idx.pred,
                    idx.exprs,
                    idx.k,
                    idx.coll,
                    idx.cls,
                    idx.opt,
                    count(*) AS cnt
                   FROM idx
                  GROUP BY idx.indrelid, idx.indisunique, idx.amname, idx.pred, idx.exprs, idx.k, idx.coll, idx.cls, idx.opt
                 HAVING count(*) > 1) d_1
          GROUP BY d_1.indrelid
        ), ux_account_local AS (
         SELECT i.indrelid,
            bool_or(ordcols.cols = ARRAY['account_id'::name, 'local_id'::name] AND i.indisunique) AS has_ux_account_local
           FROM pg_index i
             JOIN pg_class t_1 ON t_1.oid = i.indrelid
             JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t_1.relnamespace
             CROSS JOIN LATERAL ( SELECT array_agg(a.attname ORDER BY k.ord) AS cols
                   FROM unnest(i.indkey) WITH ORDINALITY k(attnum, ord)
                     JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = i.indrelid AND a.attnum = k.attnum) ordcols
          WHERE n.nspname = 'public'::name AND (t_1.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'p'::"char"]))
          GROUP BY i.indrelid
        )
 SELECT t.schema,
    t.name AS table_name,
    t.relkind,
    COALESCE(c.has_account_id, false) AS has_account_id,
    COALESCE(c.has_updated_at, false) AS has_updated_at,
    t.relrowsecurity AS rls_enabled,
    COALESCE(p.pol_star, 0::bigint) AS pol_star,
    COALESCE(p.pol_legacy, 0::bigint) AS pol_legacy,
    (t.oid IN ( SELECT touch_trg.oid
           FROM touch_trg)) AS has_touch_trg,
    (t.oid IN ( SELECT fill_trg.oid
           FROM fill_trg)) AS has_fill_trg,
    COALESCE(d.dup_indexes, 0::numeric) AS dup_index_count,
        CASE
            WHEN COALESCE(c.has_account_id, false) AND (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
               FROM information_schema.columns ic
              WHERE ic.table_schema::name = t.schema AND ic.table_name::name = t.name AND ic.column_name::name = 'local_id'::name)) THEN COALESCE(u.has_ux_account_local, false)
            ELSE NULL::boolean
        END AS has_ux_account_local
   FROM tbls t
     LEFT JOIN cols c ON c.table_schema::name = t.schema AND c.table_name::name = t.name
     LEFT JOIN pol p ON p.oid = t.oid
     LEFT JOIN idx_dups d ON d.indrelid = t.oid
     LEFT JOIN ux_account_local u ON u.indrelid = t.oid
  ORDER BY t.schema, t.name;

SELECT sequence_schema AS schema,
    sequence_name,
    data_type,
    start_value,
    minimum_value,
    maximum_value,
    increment,
    cycle_option
   FROM information_schema.sequences
  WHERE sequence_schema::name <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY sequence_schema, sequence_name;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    c.relname AS name,
        CASE c.relkind
            WHEN 'r'::"char" THEN 'table'::text
            WHEN 'i'::"char" THEN 'index'::text
            WHEN 'm'::"char" THEN 'materialized_view'::text
            ELSE c.relkind::text
        END AS kind,
    pg_total_relation_size(c.oid::regclass) AS total_bytes,
    pg_relation_size(c.oid::regclass) AS rel_bytes,
    pg_indexes_size(c.oid::regclass) AS idx_bytes
   FROM pg_class c
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
  WHERE (n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])) AND (c.relkind = ANY (ARRAY['r'::"char", 'i'::"char", 'm'::"char"]))
  ORDER BY (pg_total_relation_size(c.oid::regclass)) DESC;

SELECT id,
    name,
    owner,
    public,
    file_size_limit,
    allowed_mime_types,
    avif_autodetection,
    created_at,
    updated_at
   FROM storage.buckets b
  ORDER BY name;

SELECT cols.table_schema AS schema,
    cols.table_name,
    cols.ordinal_position,
    cols.column_name,
    cols.data_type,
    cols.udt_name,
    cols.is_nullable,
    cols.column_default,
    pgd.description AS comment
   FROM information_schema.columns cols
     LEFT JOIN pg_class c ON c.relname = cols.table_name::name
     LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace AND n.nspname = cols.table_schema::name
     LEFT JOIN pg_description pgd ON pgd.objoid = c.oid AND pgd.objsubid = cols.ordinal_position::integer
  WHERE cols.table_schema::name <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY cols.table_schema, cols.table_name, cols.ordinal_position;

SELECT table_schema AS schema,
    table_name,
    grantee,
    privilege_type,
    is_grantable
   FROM information_schema.table_privileges
  WHERE table_schema::name <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY table_schema, table_name, grantee, privilege_type;

WITH t AS (
         SELECT tables.schema,
            tables.table_name,
            tables.rls_enabled,
            tables.rls_forced,
            tables.owner
           FROM admin.tables
          WHERE tables.schema::name <> ALL (ARRAY['auth'::name, 'storage'::name])
        ), col AS (
         SELECT table_columns.schema,
            table_columns.table_name,
            table_columns.column_name,
            table_columns.data_type,
            table_columns.udt_name,
            table_columns.column_default,
            table_columns.is_nullable
           FROM admin.table_columns
        )
 SELECT schema,
    table_name,
    rls_enabled,
    COALESCE(( SELECT count(*) AS count
           FROM admin.rls_policies p
          WHERE p.schema = t.schema::name AND p.table_name = t.table_name::name), 0::bigint) AS rls_policy_count,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'id'::name)) AS has_id,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'created_at'::name)) AS has_created_at,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'updated_at'::name)) AS has_updated_at,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND (col.column_name::name = 'deleted_at'::name OR col.column_name::name = 'is_deleted'::name))) AS has_soft_delete,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'account_id'::name)) AS has_account_id,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'device_id'::name)) AS has_device_id,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'local_id'::name)) AS has_local_id,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM pg_index i
             JOIN pg_class tc ON tc.oid = i.indrelid
             JOIN pg_namespace ns ON ns.oid = tc.relnamespace
          WHERE ns.nspname = t.schema::name AND tc.relname = t.table_name::name AND i.indisunique AND (( SELECT q.arr[1:3] AS arr
                   FROM ( SELECT array_agg(a.attname::text ORDER BY k.ord) AS arr
                           FROM unnest(i.indkey) WITH ORDINALITY k(attnum, ord)
                             JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = tc.oid AND a.attnum = k.attnum) q)) = ARRAY['account_id'::text, 'device_id'::text, 'local_id'::text])) AS has_ux_account_device_local_prefix,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'created_at'::name AND (col.data_type::text ~~* '%timestamp%'::text OR (col.udt_name::name = ANY (ARRAY['timestamptz'::name, 'timestamp'::name]))))) AS created_at_is_ts,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'updated_at'::name AND (col.data_type::text ~~* '%timestamp%'::text OR (col.udt_name::name = ANY (ARRAY['timestamptz'::name, 'timestamp'::name]))))) AS updated_at_is_ts,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'created_at'::name AND (col.column_default::text ~~* '%now(%'::text OR col.column_default::text ~~* '%timezone%'::text))) AS created_at_has_default_now,
    (EXISTS ( SELECT 1
           FROM col
          WHERE col.schema::name = t.schema::name AND col.table_name::name = t.table_name::name AND col.column_name::name = 'updated_at'::name AND (col.column_default::text ~~* '%now(%'::text OR col.column_default::text ~~* '%timezone%'::text))) AS updated_at_has_default_now
   FROM t
  ORDER BY schema, table_name;

SELECT t.table_schema AS schema,
    t.table_name,
    c.relrowsecurity AS rls_enabled,
    c.relforcerowsecurity AS rls_forced,
    pg_get_userbyid(c.relowner) AS owner
   FROM information_schema.tables t
     JOIN pg_class c ON c.relname = t.table_name::name
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace AND n.nspname = t.table_schema::name
  WHERE t.table_type::text = 'BASE TABLE'::text AND (t.table_schema::name <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name]))
  ORDER BY t.table_schema, t.table_name;

SELECT schema,
    table_name,
    rls_enabled,
    rls_forced,
    owner
   FROM admin.tables
  WHERE rls_enabled IS FALSE
  ORDER BY schema, table_name;

SELECT schema,
    table_name,
    column_name,
    data_type,
    column_default
   FROM admin.table_columns
  WHERE data_type::text = 'timestamp without time zone'::text OR udt_name::name = 'timestamp'::name
  ORDER BY schema, table_name, column_name;

SELECT n.nspname AS schema,
    c.relname AS table_name,
    t.tgname AS trigger_name,
    pg_get_triggerdef(t.oid, true) AS trigger_def,
        CASE t.tgenabled
            WHEN 'O'::"char" THEN true
            ELSE false
        END AS enabled,
    p.proname AS function_name
   FROM pg_trigger t
     JOIN pg_class c ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
     JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
     JOIN pg_proc p ON p.oid = t.tgfoid
  WHERE NOT t.tgisinternal AND (n.nspname <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name]))
  ORDER BY n.nspname, c.relname, t.tgname;

SELECT table_schema AS schema,
    table_name AS view_name,
    view_definition
   FROM information_schema.views
  WHERE table_schema::name <> ALL (ARRAY['pg_catalog'::name, 'information_schema'::name, 'pg_toast'::name])
  ORDER BY table_schema, table_name;

SELECT userid,
    dbid,
    toplevel,
    queryid,
    query,
    plans,
    total_plan_time,
    min_plan_time,
    max_plan_time,
    mean_plan_time,
    stddev_plan_time,
    calls,
    total_exec_time,
    min_exec_time,
    max_exec_time,
    mean_exec_time,
    stddev_exec_time,
    rows,
    shared_blks_hit,
    shared_blks_read,
    shared_blks_dirtied,
    shared_blks_written,
    local_blks_hit,
    local_blks_read,
    local_blks_dirtied,
    local_blks_written,
    temp_blks_read,
    temp_blks_written,
    shared_blk_read_time,
    shared_blk_write_time,
    local_blk_read_time,
    local_blk_write_time,
    temp_blk_read_time,
    temp_blk_write_time,
    wal_records,
    wal_fpi,
    wal_bytes,
    jit_functions,
    jit_generation_time,
    jit_inlining_count,
    jit_inlining_time,
    jit_optimization_count,
    jit_optimization_time,
    jit_emission_count,
    jit_emission_time,
    jit_deform_count,
    jit_deform_time,
    stats_since,
    minmax_stats_since
   FROM pg_stat_statements(true) pg_stat_statements(userid, dbid, toplevel, queryid, query, plans, total_plan_time, min_plan_time, max_plan_time, mean_plan_time, stddev_plan_time, calls, total_exec_time, min_exec_time, max_exec_time, mean_exec_time, stddev_exec_time, rows, shared_blks_hit, shared_blks_read, shared_blks_dirtied, shared_blks_written, local_blks_hit, local_blks_read, local_blks_dirtied, local_blks_written, temp_blks_read, temp_blks_written, shared_blk_read_time, shared_blk_write_time, local_blk_read_time, local_blk_write_time, temp_blk_read_time, temp_blk_write_time, wal_records, wal_fpi, wal_bytes, jit_functions, jit_generation_time, jit_inlining_count, jit_inlining_time, jit_optimization_count, jit_optimization_time, jit_emission_count, jit_emission_time, jit_deform_count, jit_deform_time, stats_since, minmax_stats_since);

WITH mine AS (
         SELECT p.conversation_id
           FROM chat_participants p
          WHERE p.user_uid = auth.uid()
        ), unread AS (
         SELECT c_1.id AS conversation_id,
            r.last_read_at,
            (( SELECT count(1) AS count
                   FROM chat_messages m_1
                  WHERE m_1.conversation_id = c_1.id AND COALESCE(m_1.deleted, false) = false AND (r.last_read_at IS NULL OR m_1.created_at > r.last_read_at)))::integer AS unread_count
           FROM chat_conversations c_1
             LEFT JOIN v_chat_reads_for_me r ON r.conversation_id = c_1.id
        )
 SELECT c.id,
    c.account_id,
    c.is_group,
    c.title,
    c.created_by,
    c.created_at,
    c.updated_at,
    c.last_msg_at,
    c.last_msg_snippet,
    lm.last_message_id,
    lm.last_message_kind,
    lm.last_message_body,
    lm.last_message_created_at,
    u.last_read_at,
    u.unread_count,
        CASE
            WHEN lm.last_message_kind = 'image'::text THEN 'ðŸ“· ØµÙˆØ±Ø©'::text
            WHEN lm.last_message_body IS NULL OR btrim(lm.last_message_body) = ''::text THEN NULL::text
            WHEN char_length(lm.last_message_body) > 64 THEN substr(lm.last_message_body, 1, 64) || 'â€¦'::text
            ELSE lm.last_message_body
        END AS last_message_text
   FROM chat_conversations c
     JOIN mine m ON m.conversation_id = c.id
     LEFT JOIN v_chat_last_message lm ON lm.conversation_id = c.id
     LEFT JOIN unread u ON u.conversation_id = c.id;

SELECT c.id AS conversation_id,
    lm.id AS last_message_id,
    lm.kind AS last_message_kind,
    lm.body AS last_message_body,
    lm.created_at AS last_message_created_at
   FROM chat_conversations c
     LEFT JOIN LATERAL ( SELECT m.id,
            m.kind,
            m.body,
            m.created_at
           FROM chat_messages m
          WHERE m.conversation_id = c.id AND COALESCE(m.deleted, false) = false
          ORDER BY m.created_at DESC
         LIMIT 1) lm ON true;

SELECT m.id,
    m.conversation_id,
    m.sender_uid,
    m.sender_email,
    m.kind,
    m.body,
    m.created_at,
    m.edited,
    m.deleted,
    m.edited_at,
    m.deleted_at,
    COALESCE(jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object('id', a.id, 'message_id', a.message_id, 'bucket', a.bucket, 'path', a.path, 'mime_type', a.mime_type, 'size_bytes', a.size_bytes, 'width', a.width, 'height', a.height, 'created_at', a.created_at)) FILTER (WHERE a.id IS NOT NULL), '[]'::jsonb) AS attachments
   FROM chat_messages m
     LEFT JOIN chat_attachments a ON a.message_id = m.id
  GROUP BY m.id, m.conversation_id, m.sender_uid, m.sender_email, m.kind, m.body, m.created_at, m.edited, m.deleted, m.edited_at, m.deleted_at;

SELECT conversation_id,
    last_read_message_id,
    last_read_at
   FROM chat_reads r
  WHERE user_uid = auth.uid();

SELECT cu.user_uid,
    c.account_id,
    sum(cu.unread_count)::integer AS unread_count
   FROM chat_unreads cu
     JOIN chat_conversations c ON c.id = cu.conversation_id
  GROUP BY cu.user_uid, c.account_id;

SELECT c.id AS conversation_id,
    me.user_uid AS my_uid,
    other.user_uid AS other_uid,
    COALESCE(other.email, 'unknown@local'::text) AS other_email
   FROM chat_conversations c
     JOIN chat_participants me ON me.conversation_id = c.id
     JOIN chat_participants other ON other.conversation_id = c.id AND other.user_uid <> me.user_uid
  WHERE c.is_group = false;

SELECT DISTINCT au.account_id
   FROM account_users au
  WHERE au.user_uid = auth.uid() AND COALESCE(au.disabled, false) = false
UNION
 SELECT DISTINCT p.account_id
   FROM profiles p
  WHERE p.id = auth.uid() AND p.account_id IS NOT NULL;

SELECT id,
    name,
    description,
    secret,
    convert_from(vault._crypto_aead_det_decrypt(message => decode(secret, 'base64'::text), additional => convert_to(id::text, 'utf8'::name), key_id => 0::bigint, context => '\x7067736f6469756d'::bytea, nonce => nonce), 'utf8'::name) AS decrypted_secret,
    key_id,
    nonce,
    created_at,
    updated_at
   FROM vault.secrets s;

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX bucketid_objname ON storage.objects USING btree (bucket_id, name)
indexes.name: bucketid_objname

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_name_bucket_level_unique ON storage.objects USING btree (name COLLATE "C", bucket_id, level)
indexes.name: idx_name_bucket_level_unique

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX idx_objects_bucket_id_name ON storage.objects USING btree (bucket_id, name COLLATE "C")
indexes.name: idx_objects_bucket_id_name

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX idx_objects_lower_name ON storage.objects USING btree ((path_tokens[level]), lower(name) text_pattern_ops, bucket_id, level)
indexes.name: idx_objects_lower_name

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX name_prefix_search ON storage.objects USING btree (name text_pattern_ops)
indexes.name: name_prefix_search

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX objects_bucket_id_level_idx ON storage.objects USING btree (bucket_id, level, name COLLATE "C")
indexes.name: objects_bucket_id_level_idx

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX objects_pkey ON storage.objects USING btree (id)
indexes.name: objects_pkey

triggers.def: CREATE TRIGGER objects_delete_delete_prefix AFTER DELETE ON storage.objects FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION storage.delete_prefix_hierarchy_trigger()
triggers.name: objects_delete_delete_prefix

triggers.def: CREATE TRIGGER objects_insert_create_prefix BEFORE INSERT ON storage.objects FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION storage.objects_insert_prefix_trigger()
triggers.name: objects_insert_create_prefix

triggers.def: CREATE TRIGGER objects_update_create_prefix BEFORE UPDATE ON storage.objects FOR EACH ROW WHEN (new.name <> old.name OR new.bucket_id <> old.bucket_id) EXECUTE FUNCTION storage.objects_update_prefix_trigger()
triggers.name: objects_update_create_prefix

triggers.def: CREATE TRIGGER update_objects_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON storage.objects FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION storage.update_updated_at_column()
triggers.name: update_objects_updated_at

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX idx_prefixes_lower_name ON storage.prefixes USING btree (bucket_id, level, ((string_to_array(name, '/'::text))[level]), lower(name) text_pattern_ops)
indexes.name: idx_prefixes_lower_name

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX prefixes_pkey ON storage.prefixes USING btree (bucket_id, level, name)
indexes.name: prefixes_pkey

triggers.def: CREATE TRIGGER prefixes_create_hierarchy BEFORE INSERT ON storage.prefixes FOR EACH ROW WHEN (pg_trigger_depth() < 1) EXECUTE FUNCTION storage.prefixes_insert_trigger()
triggers.name: prefixes_create_hierarchy

triggers.def: CREATE TRIGGER prefixes_delete_hierarchy AFTER DELETE ON storage.prefixes FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION storage.delete_prefix_hierarchy_trigger()
triggers.name: prefixes_delete_hierarchy

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX idx_multipart_uploads_list ON storage.s3_multipart_uploads USING btree (bucket_id, key, created_at)
indexes.name: idx_multipart_uploads_list

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX s3_multipart_uploads_pkey ON storage.s3_multipart_uploads USING btree (id)
indexes.name: s3_multipart_uploads_pkey

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX s3_multipart_uploads_parts_pkey ON storage.s3_multipart_uploads_parts USING btree (id)
indexes.name: s3_multipart_uploads_parts_pkey

constraints.name: s3_multipart_uploads_parts_upload_id_fkey
constraints.definition: FOREIGN KEY (upload_id) REFERENCES storage.s3_multipart_uploads(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX schema_migrations_pkey ON supabase_migrations.schema_migrations USING btree (version)
indexes.name: schema_migrations_pkey

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX seed_files_pkey ON supabase_migrations.seed_files USING btree (path)
indexes.name: seed_files_pkey

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX secrets_name_idx ON vault.secrets USING btree (name) WHERE (name IS NOT NULL)
indexes.name: secrets_name_idx

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX secrets_pkey ON vault.secrets USING btree (id)
indexes.name: secrets_pkey

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.current_account_ids()
 RETURNS SETOF uuid
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
  select m.account_id
  from memberships m
  where m.user_id = auth.uid()
$function$
functions.name: current_account_ids

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.has_account_access(p_account_id uuid)
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public', 'app'
AS $function$
  select
    -- Ù…Ø§Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨
    exists (
      select 1
      from public.accounts a
      where a.id = p_account_id
        and a.owner_uid = auth.uid()
    )
    or
    -- Ù…ÙˆØ¸Ù‘Ù Ø¶Ù…Ù† Ù‡Ø°Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ ÙˆØºÙŠØ± Ù…Ø¹Ø·Ù‘Ù„
    exists (
      select 1
      from public.account_users au
      where au.account_id = p_account_id
        and au.user_uid   = auth.uid()
        and coalesce(au.disabled, false) = false
    );
$function$
functions.name: has_account_access

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.is_super_admin()
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
  select exists (
    select 1
    from public.super_admins s
    where s.user_uid = auth.uid()
  );
$function$
functions.name: is_super_admin

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.is_super_admin(p_uid uuid)
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$ select false; $function$
functions.name: is_super_admin

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.jwt_email()
 RETURNS text
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select coalesce(
    (auth.jwt() ->> 'email'),
    (nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true), '')::jsonb ->> 'email')
  );
$function$
functions.name: jwt_email

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.jwt_uid()
 RETURNS uuid
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select coalesce(
    (auth.uid()),
    (nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true), '')::jsonb ->> 'sub')::uuid
  );
$function$
functions.name: jwt_uid

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION app.set_updated_at()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
begin
  new.updated_at := now();
  return new;
end
$function$
functions.name: set_updated_at

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION auth.email()
 RETURNS text
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select 
  coalesce(
    nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claim.email', true), ''),
    (nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true), '')::jsonb ->> 'email')
  )::text
$function$
functions.name: email

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION auth.jwt()
 RETURNS jsonb
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select 
    coalesce(
        nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claim', true), ''),
        nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true), '')
    )::jsonb
$function$
functions.name: jwt

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION auth.role()
 RETURNS text
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select 
  coalesce(
    nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claim.role', true), ''),
    (nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true), '')::jsonb ->> 'role')
  )::text
$function$
functions.name: role

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION auth.uid()
 RETURNS uuid
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select 
  coalesce(
    nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claim.sub', true), ''),
    (nullif(current_setting('request.jwt.claims', true), '')::jsonb ->> 'sub')
  )::uuid
$function$
functions.name: uid

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION extensions.pgrst_ddl_watch()
 RETURNS event_trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  cmd record;
BEGIN
  FOR cmd IN SELECT * FROM pg_event_trigger_ddl_commands()
  LOOP
    IF cmd.command_tag IN (
      'CREATE SCHEMA', 'ALTER SCHEMA'
    , 'CREATE TABLE', 'CREATE TABLE AS', 'SELECT INTO', 'ALTER TABLE'
    , 'CREATE FOREIGN TABLE', 'ALTER FOREIGN TABLE'
    , 'CREATE VIEW', 'ALTER VIEW'
    , 'CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW', 'ALTER MATERIALIZED VIEW'
    , 'CREATE FUNCTION', 'ALTER FUNCTION'
    , 'CREATE TRIGGER'
    , 'CREATE TYPE', 'ALTER TYPE'
    , 'CREATE RULE'
    , 'COMMENT'
    )
    -- don't notify in case of CREATE TEMP table or other objects created on pg_temp
    AND cmd.schema_name is distinct from 'pg_temp'
    THEN
      NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';
    END IF;
  END LOOP;
END; $function$
functions.name: pgrst_ddl_watch

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION extensions.pgrst_drop_watch()
 RETURNS event_trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  obj record;
BEGIN
  FOR obj IN SELECT * FROM pg_event_trigger_dropped_objects()
  LOOP
    IF obj.object_type IN (
      'schema'
    , 'table'
    , 'foreign table'
    , 'view'
    , 'materialized view'
    , 'function'
    , 'trigger'
    , 'type'
    , 'rule'
    )
    AND obj.is_temporary IS false -- no pg_temp objects
    THEN
      NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';
    END IF;
  END LOOP;
END; $function$
functions.name: pgrst_drop_watch

 RETURNS jsonb
 LANGUAGE sql
 IMMUTABLE
AS $function$
    /*
    comment on column public.account.name is '@graphql.name: myField'
    */
    select
        coalesce(
            (
                regexp_match(

        )

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION pgbouncer.get_auth(p_usename text)
 RETURNS TABLE(username text, password text)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
AS $function$
begin
    raise debug 'PgBouncer auth request: %', p_usename;

    return query
    select 
        rolname::text, 
        case when rolvaliduntil < now() 
            then null 
            else rolpassword::text 
        end 
    from pg_authid 
    where rolname=$1 and rolcanlogin;
end;
$function$
functions.name: get_auth

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public._add_col_if_missing(p_table regclass, p_col text, p_type text)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
begin
  if not exists (
    select 1
    from pg_attribute
    where attrelid = p_table
      and attname  = p_col
      and not attisdropped
  ) then
    execute format('alter table %s add column %I %s', p_table, p_col, p_type);
  end if;
end
$function$
functions.name: _add_col_if_missing
functions.signature: p_table regclass, p_col text, p_type text

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public._add_idx_if_missing(p_name text, p_table regclass, p_cols text)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
declare
  v_schema text;
begin
  -- Ø§Ø³ØªØ®Ø±Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù€ schema Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠ Ù„Ù„Ø¬Ø¯ÙˆÙ„ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù€ OID
  select n.nspname
    into v_schema
  from pg_class c
  join pg_namespace n on n.oid = c.relnamespace
  where c.oid = p_table;

  -- Ù„Ø§ ØªÙÙ†Ø´Ø¦ Ø§Ù„ÙÙ‡Ø±Ø³ Ø¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù† Ù…ÙˆØ¬ÙˆØ¯Ù‹Ø§ Ø¨Ù†ÙØ³ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ø³Ù… Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù„ Ù†ÙØ³ Ø§Ù„Ù€ schema
  if not exists (
    select 1
    from pg_indexes
    where schemaname = v_schema
      and indexname  = p_name
  ) then
    execute format('create index %I on %s (%s)', p_name, p_table, p_cols);
  end if;
end
$function$
functions.name: _add_idx_if_missing
functions.signature: p_name text, p_table regclass, p_cols text

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public._resolve_conversation_and_account(p_any_id text)
 RETURNS TABLE(conv_id_text text, account_id uuid)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
BEGIN
  -- Try as conversation id
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT c.id::text, c.account_id
  FROM public.chat_conversations c
  WHERE c.id::text = p_any_id
  LIMIT 1;
  IF FOUND THEN RETURN; END IF;

  -- Try as message id
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT m.conversation_id::text, c.account_id
  FROM public.chat_messages m
  JOIN public.chat_conversations c ON c.id = m.conversation_id
  WHERE m.id::text = p_any_id
  LIMIT 1;
END
$function$
functions.name: _resolve_conversation_and_account

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.admin_attach_employee(p_account uuid, p_user_uid uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public', 'auth'
AS $function$
begin
  -- Ø§Ø³Ù…Ø­ Ù…Ù† SQL Editor (claims ØºÙŠØ± Ù…ÙˆØ¬ÙˆØ¯Ø©) Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙˆØ¨Ø± Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù†ØŒ
  -- Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ù† Ù…Ø§Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨ Ù†ÙØ³Ù‡. ØºÙŠØ± Ø°Ù„Ùƒ -> forbidden.
  if not private.is_sql_console() and not public.is_super_admin() then
    if not exists (
      select 1
      from public.accounts a
      where a.id = p_account
        and a.owner_uid = auth.uid()
    ) then
      raise exception 'forbidden';
    end if;
  end if;

  -- Ø§Ø±Ø¨Ø·/Ø­Ø¯Ù‘Ø« Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙˆØ¸Ù Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨
  insert into public.account_users(account_id, user_uid, role, disabled)
  values (p_account, p_user_uid, 'employee', false)
  on conflict (account_id, user_uid)
  do update set role = excluded.role, disabled = false;
end;
$function$
functions.name: admin_attach_employee

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.admin_list_clinics()
 RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, name text, frozen boolean, created_at timestamp with time zone)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
begin
  -- Ø§Ø³Ù…Ù‘Ø­ ÙÙ‚Ø· Ù„Ø¨Ø±ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙˆØ¨Ø± Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù† Ø£Ùˆ role=superadmin
  if lower(coalesce(auth.jwt()->>'email','')) <> 'aelmam.app@gmail.com'
     and lower(coalesce(auth.jwt()->>'role','')) <> 'superadmin' then
    raise exception 'forbidden' using errcode='42501';
  end if;

  return query
  select a.id,
         a.name,
         coalesce(a.frozen, false) as frozen,
         a.created_at::timestamptz
  from public.accounts a;  -- âœ… Ø¨Ø¯ÙˆÙ† Ø´Ø±Ø· a.deleted
end;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.aelmam_cloud_diagnostics(super_email text DEFAULT 'aelmam.app@gmail.com'::text, owner_email text DEFAULT NULL::text)
 RETURNS jsonb
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public', 'auth'
AS $function$
declare
  -- Ø£Ù‚Ø³Ø§Ù… Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‚Ø±ÙŠØ± ÙƒÙ€ JSONB
  who               jsonb := '{}'::jsonb;
  exts              jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  sa_exists         boolean;
  sa_col            text;
  suid              uuid;
  sa_in             boolean;
  sa_suggestion     text;
  super_admins_json jsonb := '{}'::jsonb;

  tables_json       jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  columns_json      jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  policies_json     jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  grants_json       jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  funcs_json        jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  super_profile     jsonb := '{}'::jsonb;
  owner_check       jsonb := null;
  constraints_json  jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  rowcounts_json    jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;
  schema_usage      jsonb := '[]'::jsonb;

  _rows             bigint;
  _t                text;
begin
  -- 0) Ù…Ù† Ø£Ù†Ø§ØŸ
  who := jsonb_build_object(
    'current_user', current_user,
    'session_user', session_user,
    'jwt_uid', auth.uid(),
    'server_time', now(),
    'jwt_sub_claim', current_setting('request.jwt.claim.sub', true)
  );

  -- 1) Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù…ØªØ¯Ø§Ø¯Ø§Øª
  select coalesce(
           jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object('extname', extname, 'extversion', extversion)),
           '[]'::jsonb
         )
    into exts
  from pg_extension
  where extname in ('pgcrypto');

  -- 2) super_admins (ÙŠØªØ¹Ø§Ù…Ù„ Ù…Ø¹ user_id/user_uid Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ø§Ù…ÙŠÙƒÙŠÙ‹Ø§)
  sa_exists := to_regclass('public.super_admins') is not null;
  if sa_exists then
    select column_name into sa_col
    from information_schema.columns
    where table_schema='public' and table_name='super_admins'
      and column_name in ('user_id','user_uid')
    limit 1;
  end if;

  select u.id into suid
  from auth.users u
  where lower(u.email)=lower(coalesce(super_email,'')) limit 1;

  if sa_exists and sa_col is not null and suid is not null then
    execute format('select exists (select 1 from public.super_admins where %I = $1)', sa_col)
      into sa_in
      using suid;
  else
    sa_in := null;
  end if;

  if not sa_exists then
    sa_suggestion := '/* super_admins table missing */ create table public.super_admins (user_id uuid primary key references auth.users(id) on delete cascade);';
  elsif suid is null then
    sa_suggestion := '/* super admin email not found in auth.users */';
  elsif sa_col is null then
    sa_suggestion := '/* Unknown column in super_admins (expected user_id or user_uid) */';
  elsif not coalesce(sa_in,false) then
    sa_suggestion := '/* Run if needed: */ insert into public.super_admins('||sa_col||') values ('''||suid::text||''');';
  else
    sa_suggestion := 'Super admin already present.';
  end if;

  super_admins_json := jsonb_build_object(
    'table_exists', sa_exists,
    'column', sa_col,
    'super_uid', suid,
    'in_super_admins', sa_in,
    'suggested_fix', sa_suggestion
  );

  -- 3) Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¯Ø§ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³Ø§Ø³ÙŠØ© + RLS + Ø¹Ø¯Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ§Ø³Ø§Øª
  with t(tname) as (
    values ('accounts'), ('account_users'), ('profiles'), ('audit_logs'), ('account_feature_permissions')
  )
  select coalesce(jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object(
           'table', tname,
           'exists', to_regclass('public.'||tname) is not null,
           'rls_enabled', (select relrowsecurity from pg_class where oid = to_regclass('public.'||tname)),
           'rls_forced',  (select relforcerowsecurity from pg_class where oid = to_regclass('public.'||tname)),
           'policy_count', coalesce((select count(*) from pg_policies p where p.schemaname='public' and p.tablename=tname),0)
         ) order by tname), '[]'::jsonb)
    into tables_json
  from t;

  -- 4) Ø£Ø¹Ù…Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¯Ø§ÙˆÙ„
  select coalesce(jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object(
           'table', table_name,
           'column', column_name,
           'type', data_type,
           'nullable', (is_nullable='YES'),
           'default', column_default
         ) order by table_name, ordinal_position), '[]'::jsonb)
    into columns_json
  from information_schema.columns
  where table_schema='public'
    and table_name in ('accounts','account_users','profiles','audit_logs','account_feature_permissions','super_admins');

  -- 5) Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙŠØ§Ø³Ø§Øª
  select coalesce(jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object(
           'table', tablename,
           'policy', policyname,
           'permissive', permissive,
           'roles', roles,
           'cmd', cmd,
           'qual', qual,
           'with_check', with_check
         ) order by tablename, policyname), '[]'::jsonb)
    into policies_json
  from pg_policies
  where schemaname='public'
    and tablename in ('accounts','account_users','profiles','audit_logs','account_feature_permissions');

  -- 6) GRANTS
  select coalesce(jsonb_agg(x) ,'[]'::jsonb) into grants_json
  from (
    select jsonb_build_object(
             'table', table_name,
             'grantee', grantee,
             'privileges', string_agg(privilege_type, ',' order by privilege_type)
           ) as x
    from information_schema.table_privileges
    where table_schema='public'
      and table_name in ('accounts','account_users','profiles','audit_logs','account_feature_permissions')
      and grantee in ('anon','authenticated')
    group by table_name, grantee
    order by table_name, grantee
  ) s;

  -- 7) Ø§Ù„Ø¯ÙˆØ§Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø·Ù„ÙˆØ¨Ø©
  with wanted(proname) as (
    values
      ('my_account_id'),
      ('my_accounts'),
      ('my_profile'),
      ('my_feature_permissions'),
      ('admin_bootstrap_clinic_for_email'),
      ('admin_set_clinic_frozen'),
      ('admin_delete_clinic'),
      ('set_employee_disabled'),
      ('delete_employee'),
      ('admin__create_clinic_owner'),
      ('admin_create_clinic_owner'),
      ('create_clinic_owner'),
      ('create_owner'),
      ('admin__create_employee'),
      ('admin_create_employee'),
      ('create_employee'),
      ('admin_register_owner'),
      ('admin_attach_employee'),
      ('admin__ensure_user')
  )
  select coalesce(jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object(
           'name', w.proname,
           'exists', (p.oid is not null),
           'signature', case when p.oid is not null then p.oid::regprocedure::text end,
           'schema', n.nspname,
           'security_definer', p.prosecdef,
           'owner_role', r.rolname,
           'lang', l.lanname,
           'exec_for_authenticated', case when p.oid is not null then has_function_privilege('authenticated', p.oid, 'EXECUTE') end,
           'exec_for_anon',          case when p.oid is not null then has_function_privilege('anon',          p.oid, 'EXECUTE') end
         ) order by w.proname), '[]'::jsonb)
    into funcs_json
  from wanted w
  left join pg_proc p on p.proname = w.proname
  left join pg_namespace n on n.oid = p.pronamespace
  left join pg_roles r on r.oid = p.proowner
  left join pg_language l on l.oid = p.prolang
  where (n.nspname is null or n.nspname='public');

  -- 9) Ø¨Ø±ÙˆÙØ§ÙŠÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙˆØ¨Ø± Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù†
  select to_jsonb(x) into super_profile
  from (
    select u.id as uid, u.email, p.account_id, p.role
    from auth.users u
    left join public.profiles p on p.id = u.id
    where lower(u.email) = lower(coalesce(super_email,''))
    limit 1
  ) x;

  -- 10) ÙØ­Øµ Ø¨Ø±ÙŠØ¯ Ù…Ø§Ù„Ùƒ (Ø§Ø®ØªÙŠØ§Ø±ÙŠ)
  if owner_email is not null and length(owner_email) > 0 then
    select to_jsonb(y) into owner_check
    from (
      select u.id as owner_uid, u.email, p.account_id as profile_account_id
      from auth.users u
      left join public.profiles p on p.id = u.id
      where lower(u.email)=lower(owner_email)
      limit 1
    ) y;
  end if;

  -- 11) Ù‚ÙŠÙˆØ¯ ÙˆÙÙ‡Ø§Ø±Ø³
  select coalesce(jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object(
           'table', table_name,
           'type', constraint_type,
           'name', constraint_name
         ) order by table_name, constraint_type), '[]'::jsonb)
    into constraints_json
  from information_schema.table_constraints
  where table_schema='public'
    and table_name in ('accounts','account_users','profiles','audit_logs','account_feature_permissions');

  -- 12) Ø¹Ø¯Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØµÙÙˆÙ (ÙŠØªØ®Ø·Ù‘Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¬Ø¯Ø§ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ± Ù…ÙˆØ¬ÙˆØ¯Ø© Ø¨Ø£Ù…Ø§Ù†)
  rowcounts_json := '[]'::jsonb;
  for _t in select unnest(array['accounts','account_users','profiles','audit_logs','account_feature_permissions']) loop
    if to_regclass('public.'||_t) is not null then
      execute format('select count(*)::bigint from public.%I', _t) into _rows;
    else
      _rows := null;
    end if;
    rowcounts_json := rowcounts_json || jsonb_build_array(jsonb_build_object('table', _t, 'rows', _rows));
  end loop;

  -- 13) ØµÙ„Ø§Ø­ÙŠØ© USAGE Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙƒÙŠÙ…Ø§
  select coalesce(
           jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object(
             'schema', n.nspname,
             'authenticated_has_usage', has_schema_privilege('authenticated', n.oid, 'USAGE'),
             'anon_has_usage',          has_schema_privilege('anon',          n.oid, 'USAGE')
           )),
           '[]'::jsonb
         )
    into schema_usage
  from pg_namespace n
  where n.nspname in ('public');

  -- ØªØ¬Ù…ÙŠØ¹ Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‚Ø±ÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„ÙƒØ§Ù…Ù„
  return jsonb_build_object(
    'whoami', who,
    'extensions', exts,
    'super_admins', super_admins_json,
    'tables', tables_json,
    'columns', columns_json,
    'policies', policies_json,
    'grants', grants_json,
    'functions', funcs_json,
    'super_profile', super_profile,
    'owner_check', owner_check,
    'constraints', constraints_json,
    'row_counts', rowcounts_json,
    'schema_usage', schema_usage
  );
end
$function$
functions.name: aelmam_cloud_diagnostics
app_is_super_admin

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.apply_rls_policy()
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE table_name text;
BEGIN
  FOR table_name IN
    SELECT tablename
    FROM pg_tables
    WHERE schemaname = 'public'
      AND tablename NOT IN ('accounts','profiles','schema_migrations')
  LOOP
    EXECUTE format('DROP POLICY IF EXISTS rls_%1$s ON %1$I;', table_name);
    EXECUTE format($SQL$
      CREATE POLICY rls_%1$s ON %1$I
      FOR ALL TO authenticated
      USING ( account_id IN (SELECT account_id FROM profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) )
      WITH CHECK ( account_id IN (SELECT account_id FROM profiles WHERE id = auth.uid()) );
    $SQL$, table_name);
    EXECUTE format('ALTER TABLE %I FORCE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;', table_name);
  END LOOP;
END; $function$
functions.name: apply_rls_policy

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.assign_employee_to_account(employee_email text, account uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
declare
  v_emp uuid;
begin
  select id into v_emp from auth.users where email = employee_email;
  if v_emp is null then
    raise exception 'Employee email % not found in auth.users', employee_email;
  end if;

  insert into public.profiles(id, role, account_id)
    values (v_emp, 'employee', account)
  on conflict (id) do update
    set role='employee', account_id=excluded.account_id;
end
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.can_access_account_roles(acc uuid, roles text[])
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select acc is not null and (
    public.is_owner_of_account(acc)
    or exists (
      select 1
      from public.account_users au
      where au.account_id = acc
        and au.user_uid   = auth.uid()
        and coalesce(au.disabled,false) = false
        and (roles is null or au.role = any(roles))
    )
  );

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.chat_conversation_id_from_path(_name text)
 RETURNS uuid
 LANGUAGE sql
 IMMUTABLE STRICT
AS $function$
  SELECT CASE
    WHEN _name IS NULL THEN NULL
    WHEN regexp_match(_name, '^[^/]+/([0-9a-fA-F-]{36})/') IS NULL THEN NULL
    ELSE (regexp_match(_name, '^[^/]+/([0-9a-fA-F-]{36})/'))[1]::uuid
  END;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.chat_mark_read(p_conversation_id uuid, p_user_uid uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
declare r_last record;
begin
  select id, created_at into r_last
  from public.chat_messages
  where conversation_id = p_conversation_id
  order by created_at desc limit 1;

  insert into public.chat_reads (conversation_id, user_uid, last_read_message_id, last_read_at)
  values (p_conversation_id, p_user_uid, coalesce(r_last.id, null), now())
  on conflict (conversation_id, user_uid) do update
    set last_read_message_id = excluded.last_read_message_id,
        last_read_at         = excluded.last_read_at;
end$function$
functions.name: chat_mark_read

  update public.chat_conversations
     set last_msg_at = new.created_at,
         last_msg_snippet = public.chat_build_snippet(new.kind, new.body)
   where id = new.conversation_id;

end$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.chat_refresh_last_summary(p_conversation_id uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
declare r record;
begin
  select kind, body, created_at into r
  from public.chat_messages
  where conversation_id = p_conversation_id and deleted = false
  order by created_at desc limit 1;

  if not found then
    update public.chat_conversations
       set last_msg_at = null,
           last_msg_snippet = null
     where id = p_conversation_id;
  else
    update public.chat_conversations
       set last_msg_at = r.created_at,
           last_msg_snippet = public.chat_build_snippet(r.kind, r.body)
     where id = p_conversation_id;
  end if;
end$function$
functions.name: chat_refresh_last_summary

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.conv_has_member(p_conversation_id uuid)
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  SELECT
    EXISTS (
      SELECT 1
      FROM public.chat_participants p
      WHERE p.conversation_id = p_conversation_id
        AND p.user_uid = auth.uid()
    )
    OR EXISTS (
      SELECT 1
      FROM public.chat_conversations c
      WHERE c.id = p_conversation_id
        AND c.created_by = auth.uid()
    );
$function$
functions.name: conv_has_member

 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 STABLE SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
declare ok boolean;
begin
  select exists (
    select 1
    from public.chat_participants
    where conversation_id = p_conversation_id
      and user_uid        = coalesce(p_user_uid, auth.uid())
  ) into ok;

  return coalesce(ok,false);
end $function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.delete_employee(p_account uuid, p_user_uid uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
begin
  -- ÙÙ‚Ø· Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙˆØ¨Ø± Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù† Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ø§Ù„Ùƒ/Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨
  if lower(coalesce(auth.jwt()->>'email','')) <> 'aelmam.app@gmail.com'
     and not exists (
       select 1
       from public.account_users au
       where au.account_id = p_account
         and au.user_uid   = auth.uid()
         and au.role in ('owner','admin')
         and coalesce(au.disabled,false) = false
     )
  then
    raise exception 'forbidden' using errcode='42501';
  end if;

  delete from public.account_users
   where account_id = p_account
     and user_uid   = p_user_uid
     and role       = 'employee';
end;
$function$

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_after_msg_insert_unreads()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
begin
  -- Ø²ÙŠÙ‘Ø¯ Ø¹Ø¯Ù‘ ØºÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø±ÙˆØ¡ Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ø´Ø§Ø±Ùƒ Ø¨Ø§Ø³ØªØ«Ù†Ø§Ø¡ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙØ±Ø³Ù„ØŒ Ø¨Ø´Ø±Ø·: ØºÙŠØ± Ù…Ø­Ø°ÙˆÙØ©ØŒ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ joined_at Ùˆ > last_read_at Ø¥Ù† ÙˆØ¬Ø¯
  update public.chat_unreads cu
     set unread_count = cu.unread_count + 1,
         updated_at   = now()
    from public.chat_participants p
    left join public.chat_reads r
      on r.conversation_id = p.conversation_id and r.user_uid = p.user_uid
   where p.conversation_id = new.conversation_id
     and p.user_uid <> new.sender_uid
     and (p.joined_at is null or new.created_at >= p.joined_at)
     and (r.last_read_at is null or new.created_at > r.last_read_at)
     and cu.conversation_id = p.conversation_id
     and cu.user_uid = p.user_uid;

  -- Ø£Ù†Ø´Ø¦ ØµÙØ§Ù‹ Ù†Ø§Ù‚ØµØ§Ù‹ Ø¥Ù† Ù„Ù… ÙŠÙˆØ¬Ø¯ (0 Ø£Ùˆ 1 Ø­Ø³Ø¨ Ø§Ù„Ø´Ø±ÙˆØ·)
  insert into public.chat_unreads (conversation_id, user_uid, unread_count, updated_at)
  select p.conversation_id, p.user_uid,
         case
           when p.user_uid <> new.sender_uid
            and (p.joined_at is null or new.created_at >= p.joined_at)
            and not coalesce(new.deleted, false)
            and (coalesce((select last_read_at from public.chat_reads where conversation_id = p.conversation_id and user_uid = p.user_uid limit 1), '-infinity'::timestamptz) < new.created_at)
           then 1 else 0
         end,
         now()
    from public.chat_participants p
   where p.conversation_id = new.conversation_id
     and not exists (
       select 1 from public.chat_unreads cu
        where cu.conversation_id = p.conversation_id and cu.user_uid = p.user_uid
     );

  return new;
end;
$function$
functions.name: fn_after_msg_insert_unreads

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_after_msg_insert_update_conv()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
begin
  -- Ø­Ø¯Ù‘Ø« Ø¢Ø®Ø± ÙˆÙ‚Øª ÙˆØ¢Ø®Ø± Ù…Ù‚ØªØ·Ù
  update public.chat_conversations c
     set last_msg_at       = new.created_at,
         last_msg_snippet  = public.fn_msg_snippet(new.body, new.text)
   where c.id = new.conversation_id;

  return new;
end;
$function$
functions.name: fn_after_msg_insert_update_conv

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_after_msg_update_deleted()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
declare
  _latest record;
begin
  if (tg_op = 'UPDATE') and (new.deleted is distinct from old.deleted) then
    -- Ø¥Ù† ÙƒØ§Ù†Øª Ù‡Ø°Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ø§Ù„Ø© Ø£Ø­Ø¯Ø« Ù…Ù„Ø®Ù‘ØµØŒ Ø£Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨
    select id, body, text, created_at
      into _latest
      from public.chat_messages
     where conversation_id = new.conversation_id
       and coalesce(deleted, false) = false
     order by created_at desc
     limit 1;

    update public.chat_conversations c
       set last_msg_at      = coalesce(_latest.created_at, c.created_at),
           last_msg_snippet = case when _latest.id is null
                                   then coalesce(c.last_msg_snippet, '')
                                   else public.fn_msg_snippet(_latest.body, _latest.text)
                              end
     where c.id = new.conversation_id;
  end if;

  return new;
end;
$function$
functions.name: fn_after_msg_update_deleted

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_chat_on_message_insert()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
begin
  update public.chat_conversations c
     set last_msg_at = new.created_at,
         last_msg_snippet =
           case
             when new.kind = 'image' then 'ðŸ“· ØµÙˆØ±Ø©'
             else left(coalesce(new.body, ''), 140)
           end
   where c.id = new.conversation_id;

  -- ØªØ­Ø¯ÙŠØ« "Ù…Ù‚Ø±ÙˆØ¡" Ù„Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø³Ù„ Ù…Ø¨Ø§Ø´Ø±Ø©
  insert into public.chat_reads (conversation_id, user_uid, last_read_message_id, last_read_at)
  values (new.conversation_id, new.sender_uid, new.id, new.created_at)
  on conflict (conversation_id, user_uid) do update
    set last_read_message_id = excluded.last_read_message_id,
        last_read_at         = excluded.last_read_at;

  return new;
end;
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_hard_purge_soft_deleted(older_than_days integer DEFAULT 30)
 RETURNS TABLE(messages_deleted integer, conversations_deleted integer)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
DECLARE
  v_msg int;
  v_conv int;
BEGIN
  DELETE FROM public.chat_messages
  WHERE is_deleted = TRUE
    AND deleted_at IS NOT NULL
    AND deleted_at < now() - make_interval(days => older_than_days);
  GET DIAGNOSTICS v_msg = ROW_COUNT;

  -- Ø³ÙŠØ¤Ø¯ÙŠ Ø­Ø°Ù Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø­Ø§Ø¯Ø«Ø© Ø¥Ù„Ù‰ Ø­Ø°Ù Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø´Ø§Ø±ÙƒÙŠÙ†/Ø§Ù„Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø¡Ø§Øª/ØºÙŠØ± Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø±ÙˆØ¡ Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù„ ON DELETE CASCADE
  DELETE FROM public.chat_conversations c
  WHERE c.is_deleted = TRUE
    AND c.deleted_at IS NOT NULL
    AND c.deleted_at < now() - make_interval(days => older_than_days);
  GET DIAGNOSTICS v_conv = ROW_COUNT;

  RETURN QUERY SELECT COALESCE(v_msg,0), COALESCE(v_conv,0);
END
$function$
functions.name: fn_hard_purge_soft_deleted

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_recalc_unread_for_conversation(_conversation_id uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
declare
  r record;
begin
  for r in
    select user_uid from public.chat_participants
     where conversation_id = _conversation_id
  loop
    perform public.fn_recalc_unread_for_user(_conversation_id, r.user_uid);
  end loop;
end;
$function$
functions.name: fn_recalc_unread_for_conversation

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_recalc_unread_for_user(_conversation_id uuid, _user_uid uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
declare
  _joined_at timestamptz;
  _last_read timestamptz;
  _cnt int;
begin
  -- ÙˆÙ‚Øª Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù†Ø¶Ù…Ø§Ù…
  select joined_at into _joined_at
    from public.chat_participants
   where conversation_id = _conversation_id and user_uid = _user_uid
   limit 1;

  -- Ø¢Ø®Ø± Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø¡Ø©
  select last_read_at into _last_read
    from public.chat_reads
   where conversation_id = _conversation_id and user_uid = _user_uid
   limit 1;

  -- Ø¹Ø¯Ù‘ Ø§Ù„Ø±Ø³Ø§Ø¦Ù„ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¢Ø®Ø±ÙŠÙ† Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ø§Ù†Ø¶Ù…Ø§Ù… ÙˆØ¢Ø®Ø± Ù‚Ø±Ø§Ø¡Ø©ØŒ ØºÙŠØ± Ù…Ø­Ø°ÙˆÙØ©
  select count(*) into _cnt
    from public.chat_messages m
   where m.conversation_id = _conversation_id
     and coalesce(m.deleted, false) = false
     and m.sender_uid <> _user_uid
     and ( _joined_at is null or m.created_at >= _joined_at )
     and ( _last_read is null or m.created_at >  _last_read );

  insert into public.chat_unreads as cu (conversation_id, user_uid, unread_count, updated_at)
       values (_conversation_id, _user_uid, _cnt, now())
  on conflict (conversation_id, user_uid)
    do update set unread_count = excluded.unread_count,
                  updated_at   = now();
end;
$function$
functions.name: fn_recalc_unread_for_user

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.fn_soft_delete_by_id()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  sql text;
BEGIN
  sql := format($f$
      UPDATE %I.%I
         SET is_deleted = TRUE,
             deleted_at = timezone(''utc'', now()),
             updated_at = COALESCE(updated_at, timezone(''utc'', now()))
       WHERE id = $1
    $f$, TG_TABLE_SCHEMA, TG_TABLE_NAME);
  EXECUTE sql USING OLD.id;
  RETURN NULL; -- cancel physical delete
END$function$
functions.name: fn_soft_delete_by_id

    or exists (
      select 1
        from public.account_users au
        join public.accounts acc on acc.id = au.account_id
       where au.account_id = p_account

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.is_account_member(aid uuid)
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select
    exists (
      select 1
      from public.account_users au
      where au.account_id = aid
        and au.user_uid   = auth.uid()
        and coalesce(au.disabled,false) = false
    )
    or exists (
      select 1
      from public.accounts a
      where a.id = aid and a.owner_uid = auth.uid()
    )
    or public.is_superadmin();
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.is_super_admin()
 RETURNS boolean
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select
    auth.uid() = '1af3d832-ee4c-4ca8-92d1-80b32c43fd7a'::uuid
    or lower(coalesce(auth.jwt()->>'email','')) = 'aelmam.app@gmail.com';
$function$
functions.name: is_super_admin

$function$

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.list_employees_with_email(p_account uuid)
 RETURNS TABLE(user_uid uuid, email text)
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public', 'auth', 'pg_temp'
AS $function$
begin
  -- ØªØµØ±ÙŠØ­ Ø§Ù„ÙˆØµÙˆÙ„: Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§Ù„Ùƒ ÙÙ‚Ø·
  if not exists (
    select 1
    from public.account_users au
    where au.account_id = p_account
      and au.user_uid  = auth.uid()
      and au.role      = 'owner'
  ) then
    raise exception 'forbidden';
  end if;

  return query
  with id_email as (
    select i.user_id,
           -- Ø­Ø§ÙˆÙ„ Ø§Ù„Ø­ØµÙˆÙ„ Ø¹Ù„Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø¥ÙŠÙ…ÙŠÙ„ Ù…Ù† identities Ø¨Ø§Ù„ØªØ±ØªÙŠØ¨ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙØ¶Ù„
           (i.identity_data->>'email') as id_email,
           row_number() over (
             partition by i.user_id
             order by case i.provider
                        when 'email' then 1
                        when 'google' then 2
                        when 'apple'  then 3
                        else 9
                      end
           ) as rn
    from auth.identities i
    where (i.identity_data->>'email') is not null
  )
  select
    au.user_uid,
    coalesce(
      u.email::text,
      (select id_email from id_email ie where ie.user_id = au.user_uid and ie.rn = 1),
      u.raw_user_meta_data->>'email',
      null -- Ø§ØªØ±ÙƒÙ‡Ø§ null Ø¥Ù† Ù…Ø§ ÙÙŠÙ‡ Ø¥ÙŠÙ…ÙŠÙ„ Ø­Ù‚ÙŠÙ‚ÙŠ
    ) as email
  from public.account_users au
  left join auth.users u on u.id = au.user_uid
  where au.account_id = p_account;
end;
$function$
functions.name: list_employees_with_email

 LANGUAGE sql

 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$

  from public.account_users
  where user_uid = auth.uid()

 RETURNS SETOF uuid
 LANGUAGE sql

  from public.accounts a
  where a.owner_uid = auth.uid()
  union

    and coalesce(au.disabled,false) = false

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.my_conversations(p_limit integer DEFAULT 20)
 RETURNS SETOF chat_conversations
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select c.*
  from public.chat_conversations c
  where public.conv_has_member(c.id, auth.uid())  -- â† Ø­Ø¯Ø¯Ù†Ø§ ÙˆØ³ÙŠØ·ÙŠÙ†
  order by coalesce(c.last_msg_at, c.created_at) desc
  limit coalesce(p_limit, 20)
$function$

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.my_feature_permissions(p_account uuid)
 RETURNS TABLE(allowed_features text[], can_create boolean, can_update boolean, can_delete boolean)
 LANGUAGE sql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
  select
    coalesce(afp.allowed_features, array[]::text[]) as allowed_features,
    coalesce(afp.can_create, true)  as can_create,
    coalesce(afp.can_update, true)  as can_update,
    coalesce(afp.can_delete, true)  as can_delete
  from public.account_feature_permissions afp
  where afp.account_id = p_account
    and afp.user_uid  = auth.uid()
  limit 1
$function$
functions.name: my_feature_permissions
functions.returns: TABLE(allowed_features text[], can_create boolean, can_update boolean, can_delete boolean)

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.my_messages(p_conversation uuid, p_limit integer DEFAULT 50)
 RETURNS SETOF chat_messages
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select m.*
  from public.chat_messages m
  where m.conversation_id = p_conversation
    and public.conv_has_member(m.conversation_id, auth.uid())  -- â† ÙˆØ³ÙŠØ·Ø§Ù†
  order by m.created_at desc
  limit coalesce(p_limit, 50)
$function$
functions.name: my_messages

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.my_profile()
 RETURNS TABLE(id uuid, email text, role text, account_id uuid)
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
  select
    u.id,
    u.email,
    p.role,
    my_account_id() as account_id
  from auth.users u
  left join profiles p on p.id = u.id
  where u.id = auth.uid()
$function$

functions.returns: TABLE(id uuid, email text, role text, account_id uuid)

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.reaction_counts_for_conversation(p_conv uuid)
 RETURNS TABLE(message_id uuid, emoji text, cnt integer)
 LANGUAGE sql
 STABLE
AS $function$
  select r.message_id, r.emoji, count(*)::int as cnt
  from public.chat_reactions r
  join public.chat_messages m on m.id = r.message_id
  where m.conversation_id = p_conv
  group by r.message_id, r.emoji
$function$

functions.returns: TABLE(message_id uuid, emoji text, cnt integer)

functions.def:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.refresh_conv_last_msg(p_conv uuid)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE sql
AS $function$
  with last as (
    select id, created_at,
           coalesce(nullif(trim(text), ''), nullif(trim(body), '')) as snippet
    from public.chat_messages
    where conversation_id = p_conv
      and coalesce(deleted,false) = false
    order by created_at desc
    limit 1
  )
  update public.chat_conversations c
     set last_msg_at      = l.created_at,
         last_msg_snippet = l.snippet
  from last l
  where c.id = p_conv;
$function$
functions.name: refresh_conv_last_msg
rpc_start_dm

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.set_employee_disabled(p_account uuid, p_user_uid uuid, p_disabled boolean)
 RETURNS void
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 SECURITY DEFINER
 SET search_path TO 'public'
AS $function$
begin
  -- ÙÙ‚Ø· Ø§Ù„Ø³ÙˆØ¨Ø± Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù† Ø£Ùˆ Ù…Ø§Ù„Ùƒ/Ø£Ø¯Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø¨
  if lower(coalesce(auth.jwt()->>'email','')) <> 'aelmam.app@gmail.com'
     and not exists (
       select 1
       from public.account_users au
       where au.account_id = p_account
         and au.user_uid   = auth.uid()
         and au.role in ('owner','admin')
         and coalesce(au.disabled,false) = false
     )
  then
    raise exception 'forbidden' using errcode='42501';
  end if;

  update public.account_users
     set disabled   = coalesce(p_disabled,false),
         updated_at = now()
   where account_id = p_account
     and user_uid   = p_user_uid
     and role       = 'employee';
end;
$function$
functions.name: set_employee_disabled
functions.signature: p_account uuid, p_user_uid uuid, p_disabled boolean

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.trg_conv_auto_add_creator()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
  _email text;
BEGIN
  SELECT lower(au.email)
    INTO _email
  FROM account_users au
  WHERE au.user_uid = NEW.created_by
    AND (NEW.account_id IS NULL OR au.account_id = NEW.account_id)
  ORDER BY au.created_at DESC
  LIMIT 1;

  INSERT INTO chat_participants (conversation_id, user_uid, email, joined_at)
  VALUES (NEW.id, NEW.created_by, coalesce(_email,''), NOW())
  ON CONFLICT (conversation_id, user_uid) DO NOTHING;

  RETURN NEW;
END;
$function$
functions.name: trg_conv_auto_add_creator
